alert.note: Alert for Baldwin Inland (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 31 at 4:04PM CDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Baldwin and northwestern Escambia Counties through 445 PM CDT... At 404 PM CDT, National Weather Service doppler radar indicated a strong thunderstorm 10 miles southwest of Bratt, or 10 miles southwest of Atmore, moving southwest at 5 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of central Baldwin and northwestern Escambia Counties. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
